title: Fiction: A Beast Fable in the City of Light
sub_head: Novels from Jane Smiley and Ellen Cooney, and a collection of short stories by Pergentino José.
body: With a degree of savviness that would impress even the most experienced product management consultant, Jane Smiley has combined two foolproof genres of escapist fiction for her latest book, “Perestroika in Paris” (Knopf, 265 pages, $26.95): the Parisian fairy tale and the equestrian novel. Perestroika, known affectionately as Paras, is a 3-year-old filly and champion racehorse who awakes in her stable one morning with a restless urge to roam. Taking a purse full of prize money from a recent victory, she ambles into Paris and begins befriending members of the animal kingdom (including a few sympathetic humans), who work...
